title: MIT Sloan Professor draws on lessons from Bill Gates, Andy Grove and Steve Jobs in new MIT Sloan Management Review interview
text:
MIT Sloan School of Management
Feature story highlights how next generation of technology CEOs can harness strategy rules
CAMBRIDGE, Mass. , Oct. 9, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Many discussions of strategy revolve around companies. But what about the people who develop corporate strategies? How can executives develop their skills as strategists? And what lessons can they take away from the successes – and failures – of three of the world's superstar CEOs?
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151008/275489
In an interview published today in MIT Sloan Management Review , Michael Cusumano , a professor at MIT Sloan School of Management and David Yoffie , a Harvard University professor, speak candidly about these topics and more through the lens of their book, Strategy Rules: Five Timeless Lessons From Bill Gates , Andy Grove , and Steve Jobs (HarperCollins, 2015), with editorial director Martha Mangelsdorf .
The authors of the bestselling book, Competing on Internet Time , Cusumano and Yoffie have worked with and studied these three individuals and their companies for the past 30 years, while teaching business and innovation at MIT Sloan and Harvard . Strategy Rules, and the subsequent interview in MIT Sloan Management Review , examines what these CEOs had in common, and – through examples of their successes and failures – what it takes to master strategy and execution, become a great entrepreneur, and transition from an entrepreneur to a successful CEO of a global enterprise.
To read the article, please visit: http://sloanreview.mit.edu/x/57202
For more information on Prof. Cusumano, please visit: http://mitsloan.mit.edu/faculty/detail.php?in_spseqno=41459
For more information on Strategy Rules , please visit: http://pr.harpercollins.com/books/Strategy-Rules/?isbn=9780062373953
MIT Sloan School of Management is where smart, independent leaders come together to solve problems, create new organizations, and improve the world. Learn more at: http://mitsloan.mit.edu
MIT Sloan Management Review leads the discourse among academic researchers, business executives and other influential thought leaders about advances in management practice that are transforming how people lead and innovate. MIT SMR disseminates new management research and innovative ideas so that thoughtful executives can capitalize on the opportunities generated by rapid organizational, technological and societal change.
